intro: Dufourea velutina, commonly known as the velvet sweat bee, is a small, hairy bee species belonging to the family Halictidae. It is native to various regions in Europe and parts of Asia, where it inhabits open, sunny areas with abundant flowering plants. The bee's body is covered in fine, velvety hair, which gives it its common name and aids in thermoregulation. It is primarily a solitary bee, with females constructing small nests in the ground. Dufourea velutina plays a vital role in pollination, contributing to the reproduction of numerous flowering plant species.
